Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD erred in concluding the applicant did not meet the requirements for refugee status
Evidence_Type: Visible scars, repeated refusals to join Mara 18, gang targeting
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by Mara 18 gang in Honduras
Evaluation_Standard: Nexus to persecution or personalized risk
Proceeding_Type: Refugee claim hearing and judicial review
Review_Outcome: Case remanded for rehearing with a differently constituted panel
Evidence_Ignored: Specific evidence of targeting due to scars and gang refusal
Legal_Standard: Convention refugee status under sections 96 and 97 IRPA
Application_Factor: Evidence of being targeted by criminal gang
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed initially by RPD
Decision_Review_Issue: Error in assessment of personalized risk
Outcome_of_Review: Decision set aside, remanded for rehearing
Cause_of_Refusal: Generalized risk determination despite evidence of personalized threat
Evidentiary_Issues: RPD failed to properly assess specific evidence of personal targeting
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to RPD's interpretation of personalized risk
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada - Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration matters
